item.title: 1. Single-Layer Perceptron
item.description: Single-Layer Perceptron (SLP) is one of the simplest neural network architectures. It processes an input vector through a linear combination of weights and an activation function to generate an output. To produce an output vector, the SLP uses one perceptron for each scalar element in the output. In this image, $P_{1},\ P_{2},\ P_{3}$ are perceptrons that produce an output vector of size 3.
